pr_title: issue #833 - add db2 migration test and fix issues

timeline.message:
issue #833 - add db2 migration test and fix issues

Introduced variant of e2e-db2 test for testing migration which:
1. creates a db2 instance and deploys the previous version of the schema
2. runs migration
3. executes the e2e tests

This uncovered a couple different issues with our existing migrations:
1. `DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-2310, SQLSTATE=     , SQLERRMC=-668`
    while executing runstats after dropping a column
2. `DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-108, SQLSTATE=42601,
SQLERRMC=FK_OBSERVATION_COMPOSITES_DATE`
    while executing DropForeignKeyConstraint
3. `DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-204, SQLSTATE=42704,
SQLERRMC=FK_OBSERVATION_COMPOSITES_DATE`
    while executing DropForeignKeyConstraint

For number 1, the fix was to avoid executing RUNSTATS until after the
table with the dropped column has been REORGed.

For number 2, the fix was to stop qualifying the constraintName with the
schema name.

For number 3, the fix was to avoid hard-coding Observation in the FK
names being dropped.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

issue #833 - add db2 migration test and fix issues

Introduced variant of e2e-db2 test for testing migration which:
1. creates a db2 instance and deploys the previous version of the schema
2. runs migration
3. executes the e2e tests

This uncovered a couple different issues with our existing migrations:
1. `DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-2310, SQLSTATE=     , SQLERRMC=-668`
    while executing runstats after dropping a column
2. `DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-108, SQLSTATE=42601,
SQLERRMC=FK_OBSERVATION_COMPOSITES_DATE`
    while executing DropForeignKeyConstraint
3. `DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-204, SQLSTATE=42704,
SQLERRMC=FK_OBSERVATION_COMPOSITES_DATE`
    while executing DropForeignKeyConstraint

For number 1, the fix was to avoid executing RUNSTATS until after the
table with the dropped column has been REORGed.

For number 2, the fix was to stop qualifying the constraintName with the
schema name.

For number 3, the fix was to avoid hard-coding Observation in the FK
names being dropped.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Move "copy-test-operations" later in pre-test scripts

In the migration one, we were removing everything in the "volumes"
folder which wiped out this dir.

Also fixed formatting error in .github/workflows/build.yml

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Move "copy-test-operations" later in pre-test scripts

folder which wiped out this dir.

Also fixed formatting error in .github/workflows/build.yml

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Also fixed formatting error in .github/workflows/build.yml

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Move "copy-test-operations" later in pre-test scripts

In the migration one, we were removing everything in the "volumes"
folder which wiped out this dir.

Also fixed formatting error in .github/workflows/build.yml, switched to
jdk8 to improve speed, and renamed the logs to avoid conflict with
`e2e-db2` results

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Move "copy-test-operations" later in pre-test scripts

In the migration one, we were removing everything in the "volumes"
folder which wiped out this dir.

Also fixed formatting error in .github/workflows/build.yml, switched to
jdk8 to improve speed, and renamed the logs to avoid conflict with
`e2e-db2` results

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Set reduced poolsize from deploySchemaAndTenant.sh

In PR #841 we reduced the default to 1 in order to avoid issue #845
but the db2-migration-test is pulling down an older version with a
pool-size of 80 and so we were hitting intermittent deadlocks.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Set reduced poolsize from deploySchemaAndTenant.sh

In PR #841 we reduced the default to 1 in order to avoid issue #845
but the db2-migration-test is pulling down an older version with a
pool-size of 80 and so we were hitting intermittent deadlocks.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Update permission after updating tables

Without this, db2 was failing on updates and deletes with errors like:
> DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-5188, SQLSTATE=560D0,
> SQLERRMC=FHIRDATA.MEDICATION_NUMBER_VALUES_TENANT;PERMISSION`

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: Is the purpose of this change to make it possible to run grant access multiple times for the same tenant?
timeline.author: albertwang-ibm

replies.bodyText:
no, its so that we can call it after updating the table (e.g. adding or removing columns).
i found that without calling createOrReplacePermission after adjusting the table, then db2 would complain about the permission.
replies.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: ha, this is really interesting finding! I don't know this before, I thought we don't use column access control, so should not have to ...
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: great catch! seems we have never noticed this before!!
timeline.author: albertwang-ibm
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -679,12 +679,12 @@ public void addComposites(List<IDatabaseObject> group, String prefix) {
                 }
 
                 statements.add(new DropForeignKeyConstraint(schemaName, tableName,
-                        "FK_OBSERVATION_COMPOSITES_DATE",
-                        "FK_OBSERVATION_COMPOSITES_LATLNG",
-                        "FK_OBSERVATION_COMPOSITES_NUMBER",
-                        "FK_OBSERVATION_COMPOSITES_QUANTITY",
-                        "FK_OBSERVATION_COMPOSITES_STR",
-                        "FK_OBSERVATION_COMPOSITES_TOKEN"));
+                        FK + tableName + _STR,
+                        FK + tableName + _NUMBER,
+                        FK + tableName + _DATE,
+                        FK + tableName + _TOKEN,
+                        FK + tableName + _QUANTITY,
+                        FK + tableName + _LATLNG));

replies.bodyText: and it could be nicer if we can keep the order for the FKs - still from _D to _T
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

replies.bodyText: i didn't quite follow the order comment; i reordered these so that the order matches the order in the statements above it (in the same method)...did you want something different?
replies.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: I mean in the original codes, they are alphabet ordered.
replies.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: make a lot sense, as I remember, most of the alter table operations requires reorg before the table is really usable ... otherwise it will always show reorg pending error for sql ...
timeline.author: albertwang-ibm

timeline.bodyText: this does remember me of one question, should we force all db connections to drop first before we run reorg during migration?
timeline.author: albertwang-ibm
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -16,6 +16,10 @@ /** * Reorg the schema.table + * + * Be sure to complete all database operations and release all locks before you invoke REORG. + * @see + * https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSEPGG_11.5.0/com.ibm.db2.luw.admin.cmd.doc/doc/r0001966.html

replies.bodyText:
this is an excellent question.  the migration seems to work now without that.  my biggest concern is that calling the reorg command is actually committing the migrations under the covers because that would break our "do all the migrations within a single transaction" model.
still, i'd prefer to punt on that one for now so we can get this in for 4.1.0...maybe open it as a separate issue?
replies.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: I think we should probably add to the documentation stating that.
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: which documentation.  i did add it here in the javadoc but not in the readme
replies.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: I was thinking to the design considerations in Db2MultitenantSchema... Essentially what we discussed is 'offline' updates.
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: I updated the doc
replies.author: lmsurpre

timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText:
Interesting... it's left aligned in the output.
CREATE PERMISSION FHIRAPP.STR_VALUES_TENANT                      ON FHIRAPP.STR_VALUES          FOR ROWS WHERE FHIRAPP.STR_VALUES.MT_ID = FHIR_ADMIN.SV_TENANT_ID ENFORCED FOR ALL ACCESS ENABLE ;
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: i think this format is wonky...i just tried preservign what was there
replies.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: actually, now i can't seem to find where i inhereted this from...will change
replies.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: so sorry it was an observation - not intended to change.
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: updated
replies.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText:
I think the prior line 45 was good defensive programming
it asserts if the passed schemaName and constraintName are valid
timeline.author: prb112

replies.bodyText: It was computing the qualified name which we don't want.  I will add DataDefinitionUtil.assertValidName(constraintName) in a loop in the constructor for the input validation.
replies.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: Any specific reasons other than whitespace for this update?
timeline.author: prb112

@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@

- * (C) Copyright IBM Corp. 2016,2019
+ * (C) Copyright IBM Corp. 2016, 2020

replies.bodyText: nope.  i had the edits sitting around and thought i might as well include them.  happy to remove if you prefer.
replies.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: I didn't want to miss anything :) or the commit to.  This is A-OK!
replies.author: prb112

timeline.message:
Updates per PR feedback

Added "Testing migrations" section to DB2SchemaMigration.md

Modified ddl formatting, removed unnecessary env var in ci jobs, and
fixed more copyrights

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Updates per PR feedback

Added "Testing migrations" section to DB2SchemaMigration.md

Modified ddl formatting, removed unnecessary env var in ci jobs, and
fixed more copyrights

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Added migration details to Managing TABLE section

Added info on setting up automated migrations and recommendations to:
1. avoid destructive changes like dropping columns;
2. backup the database before invoking a migration; and
3. perform the migration off-line

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Added migration details to Managing TABLE section

1. avoid destructive changes like dropping columns;
2. backup the database before invoking a migration; and
3. perform the migration off-line
